Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, but some aspects disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ryan700
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 3 nights at Hotel Lucci, broken up into 2 stays. Our first stay was decent. The room is small and furnishings are bare, but it was adequate. Do note that the room does not come with a kettle or tea/coffee making facilities of any sort. Only the bare essentials are provided at Hotel Lucci. We checked out for a night in Florence, and when we came back to Rome for our second stay, we were provided with keys and directions to our room, which turned out to be at their sister hotel, Hotel Des Artistes. On checking out our room at Hotel Des Artistes, it was clear that it was a much cheaper and inferior room than Hotel Lucci. This was confirmed when I checked the internet rates - Hotel Lucci was more expensive than Hotel Des Artistes. Furnishings and lighting at Hotel Des Artistes is also sub-standard. For example, you get a museum-grade CRT TV at Des Artistes and a dark, gloomy room. So, in effect, we had booked and paid for a better room but was provided with an inferior one - all done on the sly without informing us. On explaining this to reception, we were given excuses that Hotel Des Artistes was in fact more expensive and had a better location (we expected this, thanks to a previous review here on Trip Advisor). We persisted and they eventually agreed to provide us with a room at Hotel Lucci as we had requested. To accommodate us (Hotel Lucci was apparently full - strange, considering they accepted our reservation), they mentioned that they bumped out another guest. Other aspects - the lifts are fairly dodgy, breakfast is decent enough for the price you pay, toilets don't flush properly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mexicorvc
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. It is reasonably priced and a short walk to the underground. Very nice accommodating people it includes breakfast. Plenty of great eating establishments within a block and other quick food eateries across the street and down the street. I recommend this for anyone who is planning on spend most of their time away from the hotel touring. There is also a roof top patio that was great for evening get together s to review the days activities.

Reviews.Title: “don't miss this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAFA1971
Reviews.Content: nice and intimate hotel , helpful staff, located near Termini station, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “SCAM.. Don't pay for Lucci Hotel as you'll be put in a different (lower priced) hotel but have to pay the higher money!”
Reviews.Author: Jill-02-07
Reviews.Content: SCAM I booked this place 3 weeks before departure it was quite pricet but I'd read the reviews & thought why not, I was told that it's on 1st & 2nd floor without a lift...I was also told that I had to check in at the hotel next door (Hotel Des Artistes) & breakfast would be there as well, which was fine! However upon arrival we were told that we had to pay upfront before even seeing our room, we were given our key and told to go to 4th floor, I said no I didnt pay for this hotel (Hotel Des Artistes which is priced a LOT lower than Lucci Hotel) I paid for the Lucci hotel and the guy started saying its the same difference, how the hotel I was standing in was much better because there was a lift and there is 24 hour reception and how breakfast was here & if I stayed in the Lucci hotel I would have to come over for breakfast etc, I told him I wanted the hotel I paid for but might as well have talked to the wall...I have just looked at the price difference for both hotel des artistes & lucci hotel & there is a major difference, I will be mailing hotel management as by right they owe me a refund..SCAM SCAM SCAM

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for the money & good location”
Reviews.Author: NTZ11
Reviews.Content: Better than what I was expecting! Bathroom was particularly spacious. Good restaurant recommendations from the staff and good service overall. Only here for 1 night after a very long flight, but would gladly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Luccy hotel”
Reviews.Author: missvoyages
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights as the first part of our honeymoon in November 2008. It took me a while to write this review but we really enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is very close to the Termini station (about 5 minutes walk), so if you arrive from the airport with the Ryanair shuttle bus, it is very convenient. About 5 minutes after we got off the bus at Termini, we were in our room! People at the front desk were very friendly and showed us our room. They even offered us a bottle of Italian sparkling wine because we were on our honeymoon. The room was small but very nicely decorated and had all the confort one would need. It was an excellent value for the price we paid. Breakfast was included in the price and was served in the nearby hotel "Hotel des Artistes". Breakfast was buffet style and really good. All in all, we had a lovely time in Rome and this hotel was an excellent choice for us. We would highly recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and comfortable hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: potterh
Reviews.Content: i stayed at My Hotel for 5 nights in June. It was a WONDERFUL hotel. Very close to Termini station (about a 5 min walk) so we didn't have to haul our luggage a long way. the location is SUPER and accessable by both metro and bus. we stayed in a triple room and the room was clean, spacious and comfortable. house keeping was excellent! the A/C worked perfectly, CNN, small fridge, nice hot shower. the building has a lift (though a bit small). breakfast was served at Hotel Desarties, next door. the roof terrance was a treat. breakfast was adequate and the only negative thing is the coffee was awful. we were expecting to have a nice cup of cappuccino in the morning but it wasn't served (gotta pay - 2 euro each!!! the average is 1 euro at the local cafes). the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. they speak very good english and helped us with our luggages. they even managed to help us to book tickets to 'borghese gallery' (which is a MUST see). i would definately stay there again when i visit Rome (hopefully my coin at the Trevi Fountain will work!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at MY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jade_Hoon
Reviews.Content: MY Hotel was great. It was 5 min away from Roma Termini but still located at a quiet enough neighbourhood. We managed to walk everywhere and see most of the major sites in 2.5 days. The service was warm and housekeeping was impeccable and extremely clean. The hotel is rather spacious by European standards.

HotelInfo.Name: Lucci Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Villafranca 20, 00185 Rome, Italy
